subject: Sleep
title: Suicidal Ideation and Sleep Loss
description: A short lesson to help you apply Suicidal Ideation and Sleep Loss.

hook.text: Insomnia is one of the strongest predictors of suicidal thinking, independent of depression severity.

buildup.text: Sleep loss impairs the prefrontal cortex, reducing problem-solving ability and increasing hopelessness.

discovery.text: People with insomnia are 2.6 times more likely to experience suicidal ideation than those who sleep well.

twist.text: Nighttime is when isolation and rumination peak. The worst thoughts often come in the small hours.

climax.text: Treating insomnia directly in suicidal patients reduces ideation even before depression fully responds to treatment.

punchline.text: Treating sleep may be one of the fastest ways to reduce despair.

quiz.question: How does insomnia relate to suicidal ideation?
options: Insomnia has no connection to suicidal thinking
People with insomnia are 2.6 times more likely to experience suicidal ideation
Only severe insomnia is linked to suicidal ideation
